body_html:
I am also getting the same error while importing tensor-flow below are some details of my system.

deepakchawla35@deepak-server:~$ python -V Python 3.6.1 :: Anaconda 4.4.0 (64-bit)

deepakchawla35@deepak-server:~$ pip -V pip 9.0.1 from /home/deepakchawla35/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages (python 3.6)

deepakchawla35@deepak-server:~$ pip3 show tensorflow Name: tensorflow Version: 1.3.0 Summary: TensorFlow helps the tensors flow Home-page: http://tensorflow.org/ Author: Google Inc. Author-email: opensource@google.com License: Apache 2.0 Location: /home/deepakchawla35/.local/lib/python3.5/site-packages Requires: protobuf, six, tensorflow-tensorboard, wheel, numpy

`deepakchawla35@deepak-server:~$ python
Python 3.6.1 |Anaconda 4.4.0 (64-bit)| (default, May 11 2017, 13:09:58)
[GCC 4.4.7 20120313 (Red Hat 4.4.7-1)] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.

import tensorflow as tf
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "", line 1, in
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'tensorflow'`

In my system python and pip are of version 3.6 and tensorflow is install with python version 3.5 now what should I have to do to install it with python 3.6..??

body:
I am also getting the same error while importing tensor-flow below are some details of my system.

`deepakchawla35@deepak-server:~$ python -V
Python 3.6.1 :: Anaconda 4.4.0 (64-bit)`

`deepakchawla35@deepak-server:~$ pip -V
pip 9.0.1 from /home/deepakchawla35/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages (python 3.6)`
 
`deepakchawla35@deepak-server:~$ pip3 show tensorflow
Name: tensorflow
Version: 1.3.0
Summary: TensorFlow helps the tensors flow
Home-page: http://tensorflow.org/
Author: Google Inc.
Author-email: opensource@google.com
License: Apache 2.0
Location: /home/deepakchawla35/.local/lib/python3.5/site-packages
Requires: protobuf, six, tensorflow-tensorboard, wheel, numpy`

`deepakchawla35@deepak-server:~$ python
Python 3.6.1 |Anaconda 4.4.0 (64-bit)| (default, May 11 2017, 13:09:58) 
[GCC 4.4.7 20120313 (Red Hat 4.4.7-1)] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import tensorflow as tf
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'tensorflow'`

In my system python and pip are of version 3.6 and tensorflow is install with python version 3.5 now what should I have to do to install it with python 3.6..??
